Best team game of all time.
There was a time when TFC player numbers dwarfed CS, believe it or not ;-)

Clan like 404, Kollective, TBF, Cannibal, Pyroclastic, ...
Leagues like STA and OGL ...
Connections like Dial-up modems (14.4 and the 'king' 56K which only really worked at 53K max)
And the ultimate (and expensive at roughly $800/month): a T-1 for clan practice (a 'measly' 1.544 mbit/sec) ...

And cheaters... so fun to hunt them down like dogs, in pub servers!

The game is good and it set the groundwork for Team Fortress 2 which I LOVE with a PASSION. In that sense, it gets a 7/10 from me, but in the crazy maniacal universe that TF2 doesn't exist, this game would be a 3/10. It doesn't suffice to my needs and I can barely tell when I am about to kill someone or if they are far from dying. No matter how much I shoot anyone it doesn't make a difference because I am always getting toppled by enemy Soldiers who toss a single grenade and instantly win the fight. The button to throw a grenade now equals the win button.

Один из наиболее популярных онлайновых экшенов всех времен — Team Fortress Classic — предлагает десять классов персонажей: от Медика, до Шпиона и Подрывника, вовлеченных в уникальную по стилю командную войну. Каждый класс располагает уникальными оружием, снаряжением и способностями. Команды противостоят друг другу в онлайне в различных игровых режимах.

A simple yet complex competitive yet fun masterpiece that has stood the test of time since April 1, 1999 with a current day thriving, colorful, friendly, innovative, and creative user base that is yet to show any signs of slowing down or stopping with good reason. The reason this game has managed to hold up and age so well similar to that of fine wine is simple. It's something many big name titles in the genre compete to master but never can. Call Of Duty, Doom, Half-Life, Counter Strike, and many others SIMPLY CANNOT COMPETE. All soulless franchises and one off games to be forgotten in mere months NEY maybe even days! While this holy gem will need generations. perhaps even centuries as it has grown to be the giant modern day cultural innovation that we all know and love. All this is owed to its incredibly fun and addictive solid gameplay that has truly proven itself to be the basis for what makes a shooter a shooter. Just take a look at my hours spent on this fun title. YES Those are real hours spent playing! *drops mic* *unzips cock*
RIP Rick May

La Valve, dopo aver creato Half Life, ha avuto la geniale idea di partorire dal buco sbagliato questa sua brutta copia, solo cambiando il nome e aggiungendo qualche arma, per far impazzire la gente online già 20 anni fa, ai tempi sarà stato sicuramente innovativo, ma se lo provate ora, dopo aver giocato i giochi moderni, capirete che questa defecata senza eguali non la dovrete più avviare sul vostro computer, attualmente è molto datato e i server sono deserti, quindi NON COMPRATELO, io ce l'ho perché era compreso in un bundle pack con tutti gli Half Life.

Played for about 8 hours, and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. The game shows its age, no doubt about that, but I still had a lot of fun. Some of the mechanics from the sequel are obviously not in this game, and vice versa. Probably the most interesting feature not present in Team Fortress 2 are the grenades. You'd be surprised to learn that the best flag carrier in game is the Medic with his Concussion Grenades, which allow him to close gaps or jump up to the Sniper spot on 2fort. Some maps are so different from their newer counterpart that I had to look around for a moment before realizing what map I am playing on (Not necessarily a negative). I have to admit though that some chokes (especially Dustbowl) are a pain in the ass when you are attacking. The spam of grenades, rockets, and bullets making it almost impossible to push through. And finally the lack of servers and players. According to Steam Charts, the 24-hour peak as of writing this review is only 150 players, unfortunately. 

Conclusion (TLDR)
You should definitely give this game a chance, it's cheap, and if you really don't like it you can still refund it. It has a unique charm that its sequel doesn't have. I am recommending.

I think this is a oddly good game. Almost everything is good, the map design, the gamemodes, and the gameplay itself. The things that are rather, weird or bad in this games is the balancing of characters. Soilder is extremely overpowered, and scout is really easy to hit, making him the weakest character of the game. The grenades are unique but can sometimes be annoying, you cant see them that easily. However this game is still great, but it has almost 0 players on the game, which is really sad, but in all, I would totally recommend this game to everyone, even the ones who hate TF2.

If I could give this a middle thumbs, i would. But for now i'll give it a thumbs up. Its obviously not as good as TF2, but its not totally bad either. Idk if it was just me, but the game lags quite a bit. Its manageable, but still kind of annoying. Graphics and gameplay are pretty much like half life 1, so if you've played that you kinda know what to expect. Multiplayer seems fine, and its definitely not as loud or toxic as TF2, which i was happy to discover. Its also quite a bit less gory than TF2, but if you're worried about gore you're either an over-restrictive parent or just a pussy. I got this game in a back with some half life stuff for 13 bucks, but for 5 dollars, I think its a decent buy. I would definitely check out TF2 if you haven't already though, specially since its free.

What can I say? If you loved tf2, you'd like the original! I mean, tf2 is good if you just wanna log on and have a good time, but if you want something just SLIGHTLY more fast paced and even action packed (Or if you wanna be able to kill people as Medic ;D) You're gonna love this.
